task.title: Reorder flex-items using Flexbox in Codepen.io
task.shortdesc: Flexbox's order property allows you to change the visual order of content but keep source order intact. This task shows how to reorder flex-items. One use case is repositioning a sidebar above main content.

prereq.p: Ensure you have an operational understanding of HTML and CSS.
Ensure you have basic understanding of Flexbox
Also, before you begin, gather the following information:

ul.li: Type of items (navigation bar elements, header, aside, footer)

step.cmd: Open Codepen.io
Click in HTML text editing window
Create an unordered list class tag
Define unordered list class as "flex-container"
Create desired number of list class items
Define each list class as "flex-item"
Assign each list item a number inbetween open and close tag
Write a closed unordered list tag
Click in CSS text editing window
Create class selector titled "flex-container"
Define list-style as none
Define margin as 0
Define display as flex
Define justify-content as "space-around"
Define flex-flow as "row wrap"
Create class selector titled "flex-item:nth-of-type" for each flex item
Define each nth-of-type as corresponding flex-item number
Define order for each item as desired numerical order
Create class selector titled "flex-item"
Style each flex item as desired within "flex-item" class
